segment.source: This service pack contains the following changes:
segment.target: This service pack contains the following changes:

segment.source: Support for Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2: App-V 4.5 SP1 provides support for Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2, including support for Windows 7 features such as the taskbar, AppLocker, BranchCache, and BitLocker To Go.
segment.target: Support for Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2: App-V 4.5 SP1 provides support for Windows 7 and Windows Server 2008 R2, including support for Windows 7 features such as the taskbar, AppLocker, BranchCache, and BitLocker To Go.

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 support applies only to Application Virtualization Server.
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 support applies only to Application Virtualization Server.

segment.source: For more information about AppLocker support in Windows 7, see Windows AppLocker (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=156732).
segment.target: For more information about AppLocker support in Windows 7, see Windows AppLocker (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=156732).

segment.source: Support for third-party Kerberos realms: App-V 4.5 SP1 provides support for environments that have a trust relationship and mapped user accounts between a Windows domain and an MIT Kerberos realm, which is a scenario commonly used at many universities.
segment.target: Support for third-party Kerberos realms: App-V 4.5 SP1 provides support for environments that have a trust relationship and mapped user accounts between a Windows domain and an MIT Kerberos realm, which is a scenario commonly used at many universities.

segment.source: For information about how to enable this support, see How to Configure the Client for MIT Kerberos Realm Support (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=166004).
segment.target: For information about how to enable this support, see How to Configure the Client for MIT Kerberos Realm Support (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=166004).

segment.source: Improved support for application publishing and streaming through HTTP/HTTPS: App-V 4.5 SP1 provides support for application publishing and streaming through the HTTP/HTTPS protocols for Windows XP Home Edition, Windows Vista Home Basic, and Windows 7 Home Basic.
segment.target: Improved support for application publishing and streaming through HTTP/HTTPS: App-V 4.5 SP1 provides support for application publishing and streaming through the HTTP/HTTPS protocols for Windows XP Home Edition, Windows Vista Home Basic, and Windows 7 Home Basic.

segment.source: Customer Feedback and Hotfix Rollup: App-V 4.5 SP1 also includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found after the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 CU1 release.
segment.target: Customer Feedback and Hotfix Rollup: App-V 4.5 SP1 also includes a rollup of fixes to address issues found after the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 CU1 release.

segment.source: The updates result from a combination of known issues and customer feedback from our internal teams, partners, and customers who are using App-V 4.5.
segment.target: The updates result from a combination of known issues and customer feedback from our internal teams, partners, and customers who are using App-V 4.5.

segment.source: For a full list of the updates, see article 976338 in the Microsoft Knowledge Base (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=167121).
segment.target: For a full list of the updates, see article 976338 in the Microsoft Knowledge Base (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=167121).

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes 4.5 SP1
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes 4.5 SP1

segment.source: Provides the most up-to-date information about known issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 SP1.
segment.target: Provides the most up-to-date information about known issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 SP1.
